verses.name: Job 30:1
verses.text: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

verses.name: Job 30:2
verses.text: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

verses.name: Job 30:3
verses.text: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

verses.name: Job 30:4
verses.text: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

verses.name: Job 30:5
verses.text: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)
